title: Individuals Security Tracking
description: 被災地では個人の発見が間に合わず、死が発生することが多い。

f6_assessments.q0: The problem statement should have been more aligned with the current challenge rather it looks like a general statement. I would suggest being a little more descriptive in the problem statement which should make it belong to the current challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: I would love how an emergency service system can be built upon blockchain, any explanation would have been helpful, Would suggest adding more descriptive solution to the problem and the plan of execution.
f6_assessments.q2: Expecting some explanation of the solution that will be implemented in the proposal which seems to be missing. Would love to see all those missing details in future proposals

f6_assessments.q0: Great idea for an app! This would be an extension of some functionality found on Facebook and its Safety Check.
f6_assessments.q1: No plan was presented, and so this is an idea rather than a proposal. However, it is a good idea and worth pursuing with some strategy applied.
f6_assessments.q2: In asking for $100K: there needs to be more information provided to give those that would audit and assess this proposal to give them more confidence to grant this project progressing.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal does state a problem but it does not show clearly how it would provide value to the cardano ecosystem. It misses to explain any privacy issues with this tracking device. Since it is kind of an application you could argue the category is correct.
f6_assessments.q1: There is no relevant information about the skillset of the proposer and if he has a team. There is no budget or timetable or any information wich could lead to the assumption that this proposal will be implemented successfully. Unforuntately I can only rate this proposal with 1 star.
f6_assessments.q2: There are almost no informations about the idea in this proposal. A well structured roadmap would go a long way, maybe together with some time horizon. Since there are no success-metrics and no detailed description of the problem and solution this assessment is difficult to assess.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem description is clear, but why use blockchain to solve this type of problem?

Draft proposal. There is not enough information to assess impact. I would recommend checking the Catalyst documentation for reference to create a new proposal and search for an appropriate challenge to submit the proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: Draft proposal. There is not enough information to assess feasibility. I would recommend checking the Catalyst documentation for reference to create a new proposal and search for an appropriate challenge to submit the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: Draft proposal. There is not enough information to assess auditability. I would recommend checking the Catalyst documentation for reference to create a new proposal and search for an appropriate challenge to submit the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer has submitted a total of three proposals without any more content than a few lines in unrelated topics while asking fir insanely high funds. These proposals should not be taking funds away from other, more thought through projects.
f6_assessments.q1: There is no plan and no proof of experience.
f6_assessments.q2: There is nothing to audit in this proposal.
f6_assessments.reply: Your comments show that you have no idea how much an application development cost.  Also, the quantity of submission isn't limited, you might want to double check as your role isn't questioning the number of submissions but the actual idea/content and provide constructive input.  Seems you just comment the same exact thing to each of my submission, at least I had different ideas and didn't just copy/paste my comments from 1 to the other ;)

f6_assessments.q0: I find it hard to see how the problem stated would benefit from a blockchain. The proposer provides no explanation, and thinking myself, the tracking information, to be useful, should be updated frequently enough that it cannotc ost-effectively be stored on a general-purpose  blockchain. Possibly there could be a link from blockchain DID to an external server or a sidechain, however, the proposer should provide clearer plans and justify them.
f6_assessments.q1: Detailed plan is missing, so impossible to evaluate.
f6_assessments.q2: No plan of progress is provided.

solution: 自然災害の際に、最後の位置を示すトラッキングを登録し、緊急サービスと共有できるようにする。
experience: アプリ開発の経験はあっても、緊急時のサービスの経験はありません。
